cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet a hurricane)
cyclone.current_location: about 120 miles SE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-southwest and expected to bend northwest, aiming for a landfall on the central Louisiana coast then tracking north inland toward Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast, roughly between Morgan City and Cameron

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the mouth of the Mississippi River westward to Cameron, LA; Tropical-Storm Watch mouth of Mississippi River to mouth of Pearl River; Storm-Surge Watch mouth of Pearl River to Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast including Louisiana and upper Texas coastline
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (currently not in surge watch area)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) possible; 59 % cumulative chance with 26 % chance of ≥50 kt. Strongest winds most likely Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible, but present guidance keeps primary 3-6 ft surge east of Port Arthur.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, especially Saturday into Sunday, causing freshwater flooding concerns.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Port operations may be affected by restricted visibility in squalls, possible river/stream flooding, and temporary closure of the Sabine-Neches ship channel.
